fields.description:
Seeing lots of problems where users that have difficulty with the new image management tools are not sure how to fix their problems with the data they have in hand. 

For example, a user on the euca-users list reports: 

"My first attempt to use euca-create-image failed,
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-error.log showed:

Wed Jun 11 10:54:52 2014 ERROR [CreateImageTask:AbstractListenableFuture: java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker@79dba2f[State = -1
 empty queue]] [com.eucalyptus.vm.CreateImageTask$EucalyptusActivityTask.dispatchFailure(CreateImageTask.java):909] CreateImage task error
com.eucalyptus.context.ServiceDispatchException: Failed to send message
CreateSnapshotType to service EucalyptusRequestQueueSync because: Your proposed upload exceeds the maximum allowed object size.

After further trial and error, it turned out I needed to increase two properties:

 CLUSTER01.storage.maxtotalvolumesizeingb
 walrus.storagemaxtotalsnapshotsizeingb"

I see two things we could do here to help: 

1) The user-friendly error description "Your proposed upload exceeds the maximum allowed object size." is there but at the very end of the information we present. If we  move this to the beginning it will help.

2) If there is a known corrective action or list of several possible corrective actions, like in this case increasing the two properties mentioned, we should include that in the message as the second piece of information, right after the user-friendly description. 

Then, after all that, we can include the system  debug info like this "[CreateImageTask:AbstractListenableFuture: java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker@79dba2f[State = -1
 empty queue]] [com.eucalyptus.vm.CreateImageTask$EucalyptusActivityTask.dispatchFailure(CreateImageTask.java):909] CreateImage task error
com.eucalyptus.context.ServiceDispatchException:"
fields.summary: Create Image : improve usability of log error messages by offering corrective path and putting main message first

comments.body: CreateImage is not a part of 4.0 image management. It was introduced in 3.4.
What do the error messages look like now? Do they contain a user-friendly description at he beginning and a list of possible corrective actions?

The same issue is in 4.0, because we did not modify the code around CreateImage. I agree better messaging at the time of API call is needed. The nature of the issue is not that we had poor log, but that we did not recognize/check the relevant properties in the begining of the call.
[~spark], I agree completely! Hopefully we can work together to improve this. :)

I believe the volume size limit is not relevant when creating an image. There is not currently an API to reserve snapshot capacity (something like ARCH-91), so to address this at request time we would need to create snapshots before responding to the user. I think that would be too large a change for a maintenance release, and may not be a good solution. 

We could make some changes to the error log message, but would not change the log format for this issue. If we did change the log message are there properties besides "storage.global_total_snapshot_size_limit_gb" that we should mention?

[~sjones]:  I set 'storage.global_total_snapshot_size_limit_gb' to 2 and then ran 'euca-create-image -n "Create-Image-Test" i-0fc8a347'.  After running this, I got the output below in cloud-error.log.  I see the message 'Snapshot  would exceeds the total global size of 2GB allowed for all snapshots' but I do not see a reference to the configurable property.
